title: Carnivorous Plants Quiz
description: Plants that eat insects and more! Test your knowledge of these fascinating meat-eating botanical wonders.

questions.question: Which carnivorous plant is the most famous, with jaw-like traps that snap shut on insects?
The Venus Flytrap is native to a surprisingly small area. Where does it grow naturally?
options: A small area around Wilmington, North Carolina

questions.question: How does a Sundew plant trap insects?
options: Sticky, glistening droplets on hair-like tentacles
A deep pit filled with liquid

questions.question: Pitcher Plants trap insects using what mechanism?
options: Tubular leaves filled with digestive fluid that insects fall into

questions.question: Why do carnivorous plants eat insects instead of relying solely on photosynthesis?
options: They grow in nutrient-poor soil and need extra nitrogen

questions.question: How many times can an individual Venus Flytrap leaf snap shut before it stops working?
Which carnivorous plant uses tiny, high-speed underwater suction traps to catch aquatic organisms?
The largest Pitcher Plant species, Nepenthes rajah, has been known to trap what kind of animal?
Which carnivorous plant has flat, greasy leaves that trap small insects like flypaper?
The Cobra Lily (Darlingtonia californica) is named for its hooded leaves that resemble what?
options: A cobra with its hood spread
A coiled snake ready to strike

questions.question: How does the Venus Flytrap know to close its trap? What triggers it?
options: It senses heat from the insect
Trigger hairs inside the trap must be touched twice within seconds
It responds to the insect's smell

questions.question: Charles Darwin wrote an entire book dedicated to which group of carnivorous plants?
Approximately how many known species of carnivorous plants exist worldwide?
What type of environment do most carnivorous plants naturally grow in?
The Waterwheel Plant (Aldrovanda vesiculosa) is essentially what?
